CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice with call for competition
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 08C01

TI_TEXT.P: Услуги по преустройство на автомобили за спешна медицинска помощ (линейки)
Usługi w zakresie zmiany przeznaczenia użytkowego karetek

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: National Headquarters, Gyle Square, South Gyle Crescent

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY_ADDITIONAL.OFFICIALNAME: The Common Services Agency (more commonly known as NHS National Services Scotland) (‘NSS’)
ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY_ADDITIONAL.ADDRESS: Gyle Square (NSS Head Office), 1 South Gyle Crescent

PROCUREMENT_LAW.P: NHSS, NSS, Scottish Fire and Rescue, N.I.Ambulance Service, Welsh Ambulance Service, London Ambulance Service, SCAS, South Central Fleet Services.
No commitment to use or purchase from this agreement is implied.

SHORT_DESCR.P: For the conversion of vehicle chassis' into A&E ambulance as follows:
Box body: mounted on a 4x2 and or 4x4 chassis
Van body: based on a 4x2 panel van
Van body: conversion based on Island specification
Van body: conversion based on remote island specification.

TITLE.P: A&E Box Body Conversion: Mounted on a 4x2 and or 4x4 Chassis

SHORT_DESCR.P: This a ranked framework lot for the provision of conversion services of:
Mounted on a 4x2 and or 4x4 chassis.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Optional extension(s) of up to thirty six (36) months are available on this framework.

INFO_ADD.P: The values outlined are indicative only and are for the potential full procurement term of a maximum of five (5) years.

TITLE.P: A&E Van Body Conversion: Based on a 4x2 Panel Van

SHORT_DESCR.P: This a ranked framework lot for the provision conversion services of A&E van body conversion: based on a 4x2 panel van.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Optional extension(s) of up to 36 months are available on this framework.

INFO_ADD.P: The values outlined are indicative only and are for the potential full procurement term of a maximum of five (5) years.

TITLE.P: A&E Van Body Conversion: Island Spec

SHORT_DESCR.P: This a ranked framework lot for the provision conversion services of van body conversion: A&E Island Spec

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Optional extensions of up to thirty six (36) months are available on this framework.

INFO_ADD.P: The values outlined are indicative only and are for the potential full procurement term of a maximum of five (5) years.

TITLE.P: A&E Van Body Conversion: Remote Island Specification

SHORT_DESCR.P: This a ranked framework lot for the provision conversion services of:

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Optional extension(s) of up to thirty six (36) months are available on this framework.

INFO_ADD.P: The values outlined are indicative only and are for the potential full procurement term of a maximum of five (5) years.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Economic and financial standing — yearly turnover.
It is a requirement of this contract that bidders hold, or can commit to obtain prior to the commence of any subsequently awarded contract, the types and levels of insurance indicated below.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
The bidder should provide its (‘general’) yearly turnover for the last 3 years.
The bidder should provide its yearly (‘specific’) turnover in the business area(s) covered by the contract for the last 3 years.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if requirements are met:
As per the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire PQQ.

Only the top 5 bidders per LOT scoring a total of 300 or more points (i.e. 60 % of total points available in the selection stage evaluation) will be invited to participate in Stage 2 the Invitation to Tender (ITT).
The following scored questions will be included within the PQQ Evaluation stage:
Quality management systems and management information — weighting 5
Scoring will be carried out using the following methodology:
A more detailed outline of this scoring is contained in the PQQ paperwork.

JUSTIFICATION.P: This is a highly specialist area, which requires extended financial and resource planning due to the extended commissioning periods needed for completion.

INFO_ADD.P: The buyer is using PCS-Tender to conduct this PQQ exercise. The Project code is 4927. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2343

The contracting authority does not intend to include a sub-contract clause as part of community benefits (as per Section 25 of the Procurement Reform (Scotland) Act 2014) in this contract for the following reason:
Community benefits are included in this requirement. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2361
A summary of the expected community benefits has been provided as follows:
It is a mandatory requirement that potential framework participants agree to support the concept, provision and ongoing development of community benefits provision in relation to this contract.

Potential framework participants are required to agree to this mandatory requirement, provide a brief summary of the community benefits you already deliver in your business, where these are delivered and what they have achieved in outcomes.
Potential framework participants are required to summarise what community benefits you propose to develop and deliver as part of this contract if successful.

Community benefits potential framework participants are required to confirm that if successful you agree to participate in and support a process of ongoing contract and supplier development in this area including the tracking and reporting of community benefits delivered as part of this contract.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: The authority will notify economic operators who submitted a tender or (where no deselection notification has previously been made) applied to be selected to tender, of its decision to award the framework agreement which notification will contain among other information, a summary of the reasons why the economic operators was unsuccessful. The notification will incorporate a ‘standstill period’ of a minimum of 10 clear calendar days (or a minimum of 15 if the communication method used is not electronic) between the date on which the authority dispatches the notice(s) and the date on which the authority proposes to conclude the relevant framework agreement. The bringing of court proceedings against the authority during the standstill period will automatically continue the prohibition on entering into the framework agreement until the court proceedings are determined, discontinued or disposed of, or the court, by interim order, brings to an end the prohibition. The remedies that may be awarded by the courts before the framework agreement has been entered into include the setting aside of the decision to award the framework agreement to the winning tenderer(s). The bringing of court proceedings against the authority after the framework agreement has been entered into will not affect the framework agreement unless grounds for the imposition of special penalties under the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015 can be established. Otherwise the remedies that may be awarded by the courts where the framework agreement has been entered into are limited to the award of damages.

The provision of A&E Chassis conversion services to all entities constituted pursuant to the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978, (i.e. All NHS Scotland Health Boards, Special Health Boards and the authority).
